item.title: Links from 2020-10-25
item.description: Links from 2020-10-25 Brutalist html.css to go with markdown.css JS demo in 1021 bytes Internet of nothings - a wifi hotspot for connecting “smart” “internet-of-things” devices to. It returns nothing for all (non-https) sites and thus “prevents harvesting and unauthorised use of your data by not being connected to anything else”. Uses a single esp8266 board. Encenathrakh - Thraakethraaeate Thraithraake “chaotic death metal” or, like, free jazz with death metal instrumentation (it’s all improvised, I think).

item.title: Links from 2020-10-12
item.description: First off, hackernews brought me a link to awfice - a suite of minimal (read: one-liner data-url minimal) “office” tools. Text editor, presentations, quick drawing thingie and a spreadsheet (the spreadsheet being the most sketchy of four). Also on github. From there, I was clicking around sent ‚Äî another minimal presentations tool, this time from suckless.org. I mostly know them for their dwm window manager, which is so small you’re supposed to recompile it to change the config.
